intro: Pseudevax, commonly known as the false sandmat, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pale yellow. The leaves are usually pinnately divided, giving the plant a delicate, fern-like appearance. Pseudevax species are often found in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in sandy or rocky soils. These plants are generally herbaceous, with some species exhibiting a short-lived annual life cycle.
